Interface dom.net.ReliableMultipointProtocol

public interface ReliableMultipointProtocol
This is the interface (provided by the SessionView) that allows a DObject to communicate with its remote presences reliably. It allows arbitrary data to be sent to those presence (DObjectPacket)

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
DObject, View
Source Code:
ReliableMultipointProtocol.java

Method Summary
void  sendDataToPresences(DObject sender, DObjectPacket data)
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to any/all other remote views known to exist to this view.
void  sendDataToView(DObject sender, SessionViewID to, DObjectPacket data)
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to the view specified in the 'to' parameter.
 

Method Detail

sendDataToPresences

public void sendDataToPresences(DObject sender,
                                DObjectPacket data) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.SecurityException
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to any/all other remote views known to exist to this view.
Parameters:
sender - the DObject that wishes to send the data
data - the DObjectPacket containing any data to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent
java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if sender not allowed to send data

sendDataToView

public void sendDataToView(DObject sender,
                           SessionViewID to,
                           DObjectPacket data) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.SecurityException
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to the view specified in the 'to' parameter.
Parameters:
sender - the DObject that wishes to send the data
to - the SessionViewID that the data is going to
data - the DObjectPacket containing any data to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent
java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if sender not allowed to send data
